intro: Gutierrezia texana var. texana, commonly known as Texas gorse, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small yellow balls. The plant has narrow, gray-green leaves and produces fluffy, yellow to orange flower clusters. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas. Gutierrezia texana var. texana is known for its drought tolerance and ability to spread rapidly through its extensive root system.
